fr.zcraft.quartzlib.components.scoreboard

Class Sidebar

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zcraft.quartzlib.components.scoreboard.Sidebar

  • public abstract class Sidebar
extends Object
    This is the base class of a sidebar scoreboard. To create one, create a class extending this one, set the properties of the scoreboard, and complete the methods returning the scoreboard's content.

    As this utility does uses packets, it does not interfere with Bukkit's scoreboard assigned to the players: you can use both of these utilities at the same time, as long as you don't display a sidebar scoreboard using the Bukkit API.

    Author:
    Amaury Carrade

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init()
        Initializes the scoreboards API. Must be called before this library is used.

      • exit

        public static void exit()
        Clears the scoreboard API. Must be called when the plugin is disabled.

      • getSidebars

        public static Set<Sidebar> getSidebars()
        Returns the current sidebars.
        Returns:
        The sidebars.

      • getOnlinePlayersAsync

        public static Set<org.bukkit.entity.Player> getOnlinePlayersAsync()
        Returns a set containing the currently logged-in players. This method can be used asynchronously.
        Returns:
        The logged-in players.

      • getPlayerAsync

        public static org.bukkit.entity.Player getPlayerAsync(UUID id)
        Get a player from an UUID. This method can be used asynchronously.

        The returned Player object must be used read-only for thread safety.

        Parameters:
        id - The player's UUID.
        Returns:
        The Player object; null if offline.

      • getContent

        public abstract List<String> getContent(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Returns the content of the scoreboard. Called by the update methods.

        The first item of the list will be the top line of the sidebar board, and so on. If this returns null, the scoreboard will not be updated.

        Parameters:
        player - The receiver of this content. If the content's mode is set to SidebarMode.GLOBAL, this will always be null, and the method will be called one time per update cycle.
        Returns:
        The content. null to cancel this update.

      • getTitle

        public abstract String getTitle(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Returns the title of the scoreboard. Called by the update methods.
        Parameters:
        player - The receiver of this title. If the title's mode is set to SidebarMode.GLOBAL, this will always be null, and the method will be called one time per update cycle.
        Returns:
        The title. null to cancel this update.

      • preRender

        public void preRender()
        This method is called before every update method (getTitle(Player) and getContent(Player)) by the refresh() method.

      • postRender

        public void postRender()
        This method is called after every update method (getTitle(Player) and getContent(Player)) by the refresh() method.

      • setAsync

        public void setAsync(boolean async)
        Sets the asynchronous status of this scoreboard.

        If true, the scoreboard will be updated asynchronously. Else, the update task will be executed from the Bukkit's main thread.

        WARNING — The async status is only guaranteed if the auto-refresh is used.

        Parameters:
        async - true if async.

      • setAutoRefreshDelay

        public void setAutoRefreshDelay(long autoRefreshDelay)
        Sets the auto-refresh delay, in ticks. To disable, set to 0.

        This will not launch or update the updater. Use runAutoRefresh(boolean) to (re)launch it.

        Parameters:
        autoRefreshDelay - The delay, in ticks.

      • setLastLineScore

        public void setLastLineScore(int lastLineScore)
        The score of the last line. The scores of the lines will be automatically calculated from this score to the max score needed.

        If a score less than 1 is given, 1 is used.

        Parameters:
        lastLineScore - The score of the bottom line.

      • setAutomaticDeduplication

        public void setAutomaticDeduplication(boolean automaticDeduplication)
        Sets wherever, when the objective is built, the lines with the same value are automatically deduplicated by adding a space after.

        If this is disabled, you'll still be able to insert blank lines with an empty string.

        Please note that enabling this option may have a cost in performances if your sidebar is updated for a lot of people and/or with high-cost calculations and/or very frequently.

        Parameters:
        automaticDeduplication - true to enable.

      • setContentMode

        public void setContentMode(SidebarMode contentMode)
        Sets the scoreboard content's mode of update: either a scoreboard per player or the same scoreboard from everyone.
        Parameters:
        contentMode - The mode.

      • setTitleMode

        public void setTitleMode(SidebarMode titleMode)
        Sets the scoreboard title's mode of update: either a title per player or the same scoreboard from everyone.
        Parameters:
        titleMode - The mode.

      • addRecipient

        public void addRecipient(UUID id)
        Adds a recipient to this sidebar.
        Parameters:
        id - The recipient's UUID.

      • addRecipient

        public void addRecipient(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Adds a recipient to this sidebar.
        Parameters:
        player - The recipient.

      • removeRecipient

        public void removeRecipient(UUID id)
        Removes a recipient from this sidebar.
        Parameters:

      • removeRecipient

        public void removeRecipient(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Removes a recipient from this sidebar.
        Parameters:
        player - The recipient.

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Refresh the whole scoreboard.

        Calls the update methods and updates the scoreboard for each recipient.

      • runAutoRefresh

        public void runAutoRefresh(boolean run)
        (Re)Launches the auto-refresh task.

        Warning: if this method is called with true and the update task is already launched, it will be killed and re-launched.

        Parameters:
        run - true to run the task. false to stop it.

      • updateLine

        public void updateLine(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                       String oldLine,
                       String newLine)
        Updates a single line of the scoreboard, replacing the old line by the new one.

        This method is only useful if the getContent(Player) method returns null; else, this change will be overwritten by the newly-generated sidebar.

        Please note that this can hardly be used with scoreboards with identical lines, due to the auto-deduplication, if you use that feature. To handle this case, you can use the updateLine(Player, int, String) method instead.

        If the old sidebar doesn't contains any line equal to oldLine, nothing is done.

        Parameters:
        player - The updated player; null if the content's mode is global.
        oldLine - The replaced line.
        newLine - The new line.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there isn't any previously-constructed objective for that player (or at all, if the content's mode is global).
        IllegalArgumentException - if player is null and the content's mode is not global.
        See Also:
        setAutomaticDeduplication(boolean), updateLine(Player, int, String)

      • updateLine

        public void updateLine(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                       int lineIndex,
                       String newLine)
        Updates a single line of the scoreboard, replacing the line at the given index in the list returned by getContent(Player) with the new one.

        This method is only useful if the getContent(Player) method returns null; else, this change will be overwritten by the newly-generated sidebar.

        If the old sidebar doesn't contains any line at the given index, nothing is done.

        Parameters:
        player - The updated player; null if the content's mode is global.
        lineIndex - The index of the replaced line in the list previously returned by the getContent(Player) method.
        newLine - The new line.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there isn't any previously-constructed objective for that player (or at all, if the content's mode is global).
        IllegalArgumentException - if player is null and the content's mode is not global.
